data.name: Identifying identifiers
data.description:
Department of Theoretical Computer Science has put out a request for a small tool to help their work. Being true theoretical nerds, they have no real clue how to solve their problem in the real world. The problem is, given a mathematical expression the variable names should be identified. That is, for "a+b" they need ["a","b"] returned from the "unbound" function. An identifier must appear only once in the output - while preserving order of the first met identifier instance! ("a+b+a" should return ["a","b"]). Notice, the epression need not be evaluated - they just need the identifiers :-) Allowed operators are:
- No assignment operators are allowed
- No bitwise operators
- No comma-operator
- No operators like "typeof", "new", "instanceof" etc.
- All javascript arithmetic operators
- All compare operators
- Boolean operators, with following conventions: 
    && AND   should be &
    || OR    should be |
    !  NOT   should be ~
We do not have to make explicit tests for any of the "No ..." cases above. That is, all the following expressions must return ["a","b"] : 
- unbound("a+b")
- unbound("a&b")
- unbound("a&~b")
- unbound("a|b")
- unbound("a|~b")
- unbound("a===b")
- unbound("a===~b")

- unbound("x+7+x")  ==> ["x"]
- unbound("Math.PI*rad*rad")  ==> ["rad"]
- unbound("Math.pow(Math.cos(v),2)+Math.pow(Math.sin(v),2)")  ==> ["v"]
Input will always be a string but may not be valid mathematical expressions and should throw an exception in that case - such a "(1+2".
